column4: hey i installed impresive using ubuntu software center , but cant find it in applications .. how to add it ??
but it isnt running when i click run ActionParsnip
depends on the program, where the files for it get stored,  and you woudn't normally need to know.  What you should know about though is hidden program user data in Home.
try Abiword and Gnumeric as well
i used word 2010 its really great. will it work under wine ?, and i will definitely give them a try
maybe you can help, their issue is that, the screen goes black when using sometimes, so I thought may need to install a graphics card driver
is the graphic card installed ? Liara
no Liara  hasn't installed a graphics card driver  them selves,  however heres a pastebin of the lspci which might be slightly useful  http://paste.ubuntu.com/438982/
and system > administration > hardware drivers didn't show anything according to  Liara
as I thought it woudn't if its ATI
i did for me check ati site for compatibility
sure, but they don't  know what card they have exactly,  I know theres a command of some sort, but don't remember what that is
i think the command is sudo lspci |more
reminder doing the graphics card driver from website, can be difficult for newbies.
might have to tell them what to do with the file for the driver and all that

I am going through stuff that was earlier looking for something,  and just saw something I missed before.  You can do Office 2010 online now by  the way, I assume it will also work with Linux distros.  Word, Powerpoint, and Excell online yes for free, on Microsoft's thing.  Plus theres the good and free Google Docs.
